storyInfo: The Nachzehrer King's Army has been assembled, and the Duke of Wellington's as well as Dublinn's troops are primed and ready. Meanwhile, the new Reunion, led by Nine, has found its way into the chaos.

attributes.content: The Catastrophe cloud in the sky has not yet dissipated.
Should you take off your gloves, you would be able to feel the Originium dust in the air scratching the palm of your hand.
The Nachzehrer King sits atop his throne, casting his eyes across his army.
The Nachzehrer's army will not be shaken. The Nachzehrer's army will not show weakness.
They pass through the storm, beyond injuries, and over the carcasses of compatriots and enemies alike.
The Sarkaz continue to march. Until the enemies of the Nachzehrer King are completely crushed, they have no right to stop.
'They are War itself.'

Your Grace, we've sustained heavy losses. Nearly a third of the high-speed battleships in the vanguard's squadron have been incapacitated. We're trying to turn the situation around, but the outlook isn't positive.
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: That violent Catastrophe... just slammed into our front line all of a sudden.
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: It's very difficult for us to conduct standard operations in these high-density Originium zones, and the exposed Active Originium clusters greatly limit the maneuverability of our high-speed battleships.
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: But, the Sarkaz forces don't seem to be affected much. They... don't care at all. Most of them are already Infected.
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: The Nachzehrer's troops are also fielding some witchcraft contraptions we've never seen before. The chaotic fissures they spew out are... tricky to deal with. We're still looking for countermeasures.
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: Hold the line. Have the artillery in the rear lay suppressive fire, and open up a gap to the east.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: It shall be done, milord.
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: No mercy for poor Windermere eh, Duke Wellington?
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: She just bailed out the fleet we sent to claim our plaything, and you're going to repay the favor by driving the Sarkaz onto her turf?
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: I don't remember giving you permission to tap into my communications, Caster.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: Stiff as always, aren't you?
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: I will remind Windermere to take adequate preparations. After all, we are still Victorians.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: I know what you're after, old Wellington.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: You're getting ahead of yourself.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Next time, I hope you'll find a more appropriate manner of exchanging ideas with me.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: Your Grace, you shouldn't continue standing on the deck like this. Though we're a fair distance away from where the Catastrophe struck, the dust can't be good for your health.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: This is my duty, Your Royal Highness Eblana.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: You are always worthy of my trust.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Haha... Those two siblings are being extremely cautious.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: This is not the full extent of The Shard's might. They either don't want us to know that they haven't fully mastered the storm's power, or... they're waiting for a better opportunity.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: This storm should've belonged to Victoria alone, but now, we will be first to face it.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: I hear the officers murmuring amongst themselves nervously, Your Grace, but you don't seem flustered.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: If anything... you seem to be rather excited?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Indeed, milady. I won't deny it.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: This battlefield commands fear and respect.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: When is the last time I've faced an enemy like this since Gaul's Vieux Vanguard?
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: We've long been ready for this. Regardless of whose hands it is in, the storm will only serve to wash away hesitation and weakness from the Tarans, and it shall temper our young troops.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: I can see him... The Nachzehrer King.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: Let us drop all pretense and face each other in battle.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: The Tarans will not be stopped here. Our rage is no less than yours.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: Your Royal Highness Eblana, I shall secure a future for you and the Taran people.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: My faithful Duke...
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Very soon, the final chapter will be written.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Welcome, Lady Ermengarde. With your arrival comes the goodwill of the Liches.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: We will never forget. At the moment the Sarkaz needed unity the most, the Liches chose to leave their library and stand at our side.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Hehe. No need to be so formal, Your Highness. I am simply an observer.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: But, you still brought us a gift, and the soldiers on the front lines will put it to good use.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: It is but a trifling trick to play with the fissures.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: The liches' mastery over dimensional space transcends most people's cognition.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Naturally, unlike your people who've always been in Kazdel, we liches are keen on self-preservation, always looking for a place to hide our phylactery.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: But, the Lich's throne has never been removed from the Royal Court's chamber.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: We appreciate Your Highness's thoughtfulness.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: I assume you know that Kal'tsit paid me a visit on my way here?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: She tried hard to convince me... not to take your side.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: The young master of the Elegiac Court is fighting alongside them. I've heard the teachers say before that the Banshees' strength is not to be overlooked.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Dame Kal'tsit claimed that the war you and the Regent started will only push these lands into irreversible disorder and strife.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: These things are only temporary. We... have no choice but to endure.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: This is the only way the consensus needed for solidarity can be built.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: ...Hah.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Want to know what the funniest thing is, Your Highness?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Your words sound just like hers.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: You both call for unity. You both tell me that this is the only way to avert the impending calamity.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Kal'tsit...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Then, why do the two of you stand in opposition?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Perhaps because... we're both in a hurry.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Rest assured, as a Messenger of the Lich King's Court, I didn't make any promises to Dame Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Just like how I haven't made any promises with you.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: We Liches are never in a hurry to pick a side for ourselves.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Of course.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: These languishing pains and broken hearts... At long last, they will eventually have a home to return to.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Not much longer now.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Amiya, will you be able to find that path?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Damn those officers! They'd rather bring along a tuskbeast than us!
attributes.name: Infected Citizen

attributes.content: Who the hell does he think he is? Back in the days, before I got sick, he didn't even dare look me in the eyes!
attributes.name: Infected Citizen

attributes.content: Damn it, damn it all! This bloody Oripathy!
attributes.name: Infected Citizen

attributes.content: I'd rather go without those Rhodes Island peoples' inhibitors, and blow up in a cloud of Originium Dust over in Norport!
attributes.name: Infected Citizen

attributes.content: At least, I'd be able to give those freeloading bastards a faceful! They'd get a good taste of what I'm going through too!
attributes.name: Infected Citizen

attributes.content: Hah! That Cautus gave me an inhibitor too...
attributes.name: Infected Citizen

attributes.content: These bloody pills aren't gonna save shit!
attributes.name: Infected Citizen

attributes.content: ...I'm done for.
attributes.name: Infected Citizen

attributes.content: I can't leave this place.
attributes.name: Infected Citizen

attributes.content: My life... isn't worth a damn thing.
attributes.name: Infected Citizen

attributes.content: What was the point o' crawling outta Norport? These damn crystals... These damn Originium crystals in my body!
attributes.name: Infected Citizen

attributes.content: Run me through, dammit! Run me through already!
attributes.name: Infected Citizen

attributes.content: The Infected citizen angrily scratches at the Originium crystals on his arm, as if crushing them would make everything go back to normal.

Severe pain rips through him, and the newly-infected person gasps for breath. He is overwhelmed by the pain that had just become familiar to him, and a mixture of tears and sweat rolls down his cheeks.
He lies on his back in a patch of mud. Before his eyes, the sun has risen to its zenith.
Before he closes his eyes, a strand of pink hair suddenly breaks into his vision.
This is no place to be sunbathing, sir. The mud's going to get in your clothes.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: Get away from me. I'm an Infected, and might explode any minute now.
attributes.name: Infected Citizen

attributes.content: Hah, if I had to guess, I don't think you've had Oripathy for more than a week. Everyone looks just like you the first few days.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: Shock and denial, pain and guilt, anger and depression...
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: In the end, they have no choice but to accept that they're a miserable, hapless lot.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: The hell do you know? You're–
attributes.name: Infected Citizen

attributes.content: Also an Infected. What's so strange about that?
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: You're also an Infected? But, you look so...
attributes.name: Infected Citizen

attributes.content: Wait, I've seen you before...
attributes.name: Infected Citizen

attributes.content: Hello, sir. My name is Percival, and I'm the doorman at the Sunset Street Hotel.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: It's a shame, but it seems you don't have much luggage for me to carry.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: No, I meant... in Norport...
attributes.name: Infected Citizen

attributes.content: Hmm? Now that is awfully quaint.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: I was with the Mounted Police for quite a few years, Miss Percival. I've been involved in a number of cases, some of which involved the Infected as well.
attributes.name: Infected Citizen

attributes.content: Hah, I should've thought twice about how I treated 'em back then. Now, I'm one of them.
attributes.name: Infected Citizen

attributes.content: I've heard of an organization whose activities have reached even the doors of Londinium.
attributes.name: Infected Citizen

attributes.content: If I remember properly, they were called...
attributes.name: Infected Citizen

attributes.content: Percival? What are you doing here?
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: Oh, Red.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: I found an Infected on the side of the road. Must've been one of those people thrown here by the Duke of Windermere.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: Another one?
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: Truth be told though, Percival, had you not sent out the news that the separation sequence between Norport and Londinium was underway, the fate of these Infected people might've been even more miserable.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: Heh heh, I've always been a sharp one, and quite proud of it!
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: Thanks to you figuring it out, you even managed to hide our comms as a Londinium public broadcast. You should be glad I have the good habit of tuning into the radio.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: It's not as easy as you make it sound. I had to dismantle the communication station in the hotel before I could finally find a place to pass on the news.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: But, Rhodes Island and that Delphine lady did get the short end of the stick as a result...
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: Who exactly are you people...?
attributes.name: Infected Citizen

attributes.content: Have you ever heard of 'Reunion?'
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: Reunion?! Did you just say–
attributes.name: Infected Citizen

attributes.content: Woah, the whole gang's here.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: Well done, Percival. We've taken in a number of Infected persons along the way, and they're doing much better than we initially expected.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Red was doing most of the hard work. I've pretty much just been slacking off.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: And though I don't want to admit it, Rhodes Island also played a big part.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: Rhodes Island... So, they're here too.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Reunion... I know what you people have done.
attributes.name: Infected Citizen

attributes.content: What kind of disaster are you trying to invite upon Victoria this time?
attributes.name: Infected Citizen

attributes.content: You have the wrong idea, sir.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: We are the ones who gathered the debris from the ashes of the previous Reunion.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: But, we are no longer what we used to be.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: We will not abandon the name, nor the sins it carries. We must remember our past mistakes, but must also set out once more to prove ourselves to the Infected.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: The new Reunion no longer needs a leader. We've traveled across several countries, fighting side-by-side with the Infected peoples who see themselves as our comrades.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: What exactly are you trying to do?
attributes.name: Infected Citizen

attributes.content: Medicine and compassion cannot help the Infected in a way that matters, but solidary and strength can.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Sir, the Infected have no country of their own, so the new Reunion shall be where they belong.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Interested in joining us?
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Talulah? What are you looking at?
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: The lingering Catastrophe cloud. The Shard has been activated.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Ugh, there's gonna be a lot more Infected soon.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: I also have a message for you, Talulah.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: I saw... a Draco who wielded purple flames.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: Did you now...?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Percival, I often find myself thinking these days–
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Indeed, there's a certain kind of person that seems naturally born to make waves. They will claim to be their catalysts, leaders, and creators.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: In a sense, they tend to find success... but I would never call them winners.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I refuse to accept... that everything they've made deserves to enter the annals of 'history.'
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I refuse to accept it.
attributes.name: Talulah
